DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the bridge therapy that was administered.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Therapy intended to transition a patient from one therapy or medication to another or maintain their health or status until they are a candidate for a therapy or have decided on a therapy._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A regimen consisting of dinutuximab, irinotecan and temozolomide that can potentially be used for the treatment of neuroblastoma.

Concepts.definition: A regimen consisting of dinutuximab, irinotecan and temozolomide that can potentially be used for the treatment of neuroblastoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chimeric mouse/human monoclonal antibody with potential antineoplastic activity. Dinutuximab binds to the ganglioside GD2 and induces antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity and complement-dependent cytotoxicity against GD2-expressing tumor cells.  GD2 is overexpressed in malignant melanoma, neuroblastoma, osteosarcoma, and small cell carcinoma of the lung.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A chemotherapy other than the one specified.

Concepts.definition: A chimeric mouse/human monoclonal antibody with potential antineoplastic activity. Dinutuximab binds to the ganglioside GD2 and induces antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity and complement-dependent cytotoxicity against GD2-expressing tumor cells.  GD2 is overexpressed in malignant melanoma, neuroblastoma, osteosarcoma, and small cell carcinoma of the lung.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A chemotherapy other than the one specified.
